content: this cute unicorn toy is destined to a child but it is so cute your may want to keep it on your shelve the pattern is very easy to follow with step-by-step pictures you can try it as your first crochet work if you are used to crochet you can download the shorter pattern without pictures if you like unicorns you can also try this unicorn lovey https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/unicorn-lovey-13 **hook** this pattern is worked with a small crochet 3 3 25 d 3 5 e 3 75 f or 4 g refer to your yarn s hook size recommendations and go one size smaller it will give structure to your unicorn **yarn** use any dk yarn 8ply of your liking you will need 7 yarn colors * color a / head color shown as white 150 meters / 164 yards * color b / muzzle and hoofs shown as pink 100 meters / 110 yards * color c / horn shown as gray 3 meters / 3 3 yards * color d / hair shown as purple 20 meters / 22 yards * color e / hair shown as orange 15 meters / 16 yars * color f / hair shown as blue 15 meters / 16 yards * color g / fringe shown as green 25 meters / 27 yards * in addition you will need a bit of black and withe yarn for the eyes **other material** fiberfill stuffing **techniques and stitches** everything is explain in the pattern preambule chain magic_ring sl single_crochet half_double_crochet increase inv decrease have fun
